Posted By: JanusAurelius (2/10/2012 11:07:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Banefire = cost 4 mana for 3 damage, sorcery speed, and cannot be countered/prevented at 6+ mana.  
  
Urza's Rage = cost 3 mana for 3 damage, instant speed, cannot be countered, and cannot be prevented at 12 mana.  
  
While Rage lacks variability in terms of how much damage you do or how much mana you spend, it's a solid card. If you have two Banefire in hand, you may be able to kill your opponent in two turns but it would leave you tapped out, whereas Urza's would allow you open mana to react should opponent plays something dangerous. Don't forget Urza's Rage can't be countered right from start.  
  
Banefire for straight burn, but Urza's Rage is probably a better choice for counter-burn variant as a finisher.
posts.html:

Urza's Rage = cost 3 mana for 3 damage, instant speed, cannot be countered, and cannot be prevented at 12 mana.

While Rage lacks variability in terms of how much damage you do or how much mana you spend, it's a solid card. If you have two Banefire in hand, you may be able to kill your opponent in two turns but it would leave you tapped out, whereas Urza's would allow you open mana to react should opponent plays something dangerous. Don't forget Urza's Rage can't be countered right from start.

Banefire for straight burn, but Urza's Rage is probably a better choice for counter-burn variant as a finisher.

Posted By: TheWrathofShane (3/9/2012 3:06:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yep, this is as Mythic as it gets. Perfect place to reprint it, too. Mythic rares should be (1) iconic, defining the spirit of the set by portraying some really important character or item or event, (2) unique or nearly unique, in some gameplay-defining way, and (3) absurdly mana-overcosted, so that they are bombs in draft and fun to play in casual, but not the new $100 must-have-to-play-in-constructed-tournaments card.  
  
Mythic cards don't need to be *good*; they need to be *awesome*. And, Urza's Rage is a perfect example of a not-good awesome card: an effective CMC of 12 is not good, but 10 uncounterable unpreventable damage is awesome.  
  
Three uncounterable unpreventable damage for three mana isn't bad, but personally I'm more terrified of the fact that *if you make Urza mad he will channel ![10](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=10&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) of HAAATE at you at instant speed.*  
  
Don't make that dude angry. You won't like what he does with his four Black Lotuses when he's angry...
posts.html:
Yep, this is as Mythic as it gets. Perfect place to reprint it, too. Mythic rares should be (1) iconic, defining the spirit of the set by portraying some really important character or item or event, (2) unique or nearly unique, in some gameplay-defining way, and (3) absurdly mana-overcosted, so that they are bombs in draft and fun to play in casual, but not the new $100 must-have-to-play-in-constructed-tournaments card.

Mythic cards don't need to be good; they need to be awesome. And, Urza's Rage is a perfect example of a not-good awesome card: an effective CMC of 12 is not good, but 10 uncounterable unpreventable damage is awesome.

Three uncounterable unpreventable damage for three mana isn't bad, but personally I'm more terrified of the fact that if you make Urza mad he will channel of HAAATE at you at instant speed.

Don't make that dude angry. You won't like what he does with his four Black Lotuses when he's angry...
